name: places/ChIJJZ8LLitZwokRc0ip1n369sE
formattedAddress: 753 Broadway SPC 753, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 753 Broadway SPC 753, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text: Here is the employee that I got the worst customer service from in my entire life. She was argumentative and wouldn’t listen, as well as repeatedly cut me off when I was speaking. When I asked for the store number, she refused to give it to me. When I asked for her name, she refused to tell me and said “I don’t have a name.” I left in tears, and it ruined my day. She just doubled down on her rudeness with no empathy or apology. I will never shop at this GNC again.

text.text: Here is the employee that I got the worst customer service from in my entire life. She was argumentative and wouldn’t listen, as well as repeatedly cut me off when I was speaking. When I asked for the store number, she refused to give it to me. When I asked for her name, she refused to tell me and said “I don’t have a name.” I left in tears, and it ruined my day. She just doubled down on her rudeness with no empathy or apology. I will never shop at this GNC again.

originalText.text: Extremely rude manager. She insisted that I could not make the transaction without providing my email and phone number. I said I just wanted to buy the vitamins. After an extended conversation she refused and made me provide all my information, promising that I would not get any promotional email. Then 48 hour later I got promotional spam from GNC. A company and manager that will manipulate and lie to your face is not worth your custom. Terrible customer manners on top of that. Avoid at all costs.

originalText.text: Good service. Employee was kind. She helped me find items I was looking for with ease. Store is pretty small but had what I needed.

text.text: Good service. Employee was kind. She helped me find items I was looking for with ease. Store is pretty small but had what I needed.

originalText.text: Worst experience I’ve ever had at a GNC. Rude and mean. Wouldn’t EVER go back. Terrible customer service. Doesn’t follow GNC nationwide pricematch policies. Told us that her manager would fire her if she followed GNC policy. Then said she wouldn’t tell us the store number or her name. People left in tears after she yelled at them. I can’t even begin to describe how this self-described “old school” salesperson who said “I don’t have a name” should move on to a career where she doesn’t work with customers.

originalText.text: I’ve been waiting for 20 minutes after the store was suppose to open, nothing. Please get employees who can get there on time.
